isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 1: ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - SECTION 1.8: VEHICLE FEATURES - STANDARD FEATURES - COLD IDLE ADVANCE

svcproc.title: COLD IDLE ADVANCE
svcproc.para: This feature provides an increase in engine cold idle speed of up to 875 rpm (normal idle 700 rpm) for a faster warm up to nominal operating temperature. This is accomplished through the electronic control module monitoring the engine coolant temperature sensor input and adjusting injector operation as required. Low idle speed is increased proportionally when the engine's coolant temperature is below 158°F (70°C) (700rpm) to 14°F (-10°C) (875 rpm maximum).
